context: When using with a PC, are you still getting 7.1 Surround sound? Or is 7.1 only work with Playstation 3/4?

But if not then the headphones will try to recreate what they can but not likely anything more than 5.1. But just check out what your laptop pushes and that'll be the determining factor.

context: Is this game easier or harder than the wii's Donkey Kong?

response: Yes. It works with Windows 8. I've had mine 4 years. Bought it used. Never had any problems with it.

context: Does this have campaign mode?
response: There are multiple campaigns that you can do, starting with Atila the Hun through the Aztecs.

context: Does it work with linux?
response: I had it working on Rasbian with RetroPie installed.  The device stopped working all together on any machine after 3 days though.

context: How long is the cable, is there any way to lengthen it?
response: The USB Cable it's self is 6 to 10 feet long, the headset cable that plugs from the headset into the Volume Control Unit is relatively short, probably less than a foot, but with the length of the USB cable, this will work in most rooms.

context: Will this Joystick work on an older computer using windows 98?
response: I think so. it uses a USB plug so if your older PC has a USB port thenit will work.

context: Does anyone suffer LED backlighting outage issues, like owners of the K70 do? It's an issue with the K70, so is it an issue with the K50?
response: I had mine K50 for like 4 months and there hasn't been any issue with the backlight

context: Does this game require internet connection to play?
response: The Walking Dead requires an internet connection to download both the game itself and a game distribution program called Steam. A constant internet connection is not required to play.

context: I know it says that the station will let you know when the controllers are fully charged, will it prevent overcharging?
response: I'm no scientist but if the device knows when the controllers are charged, why wouldnt it stop charging them? thats generally how chargers work.

context: do i need internet connection to download dlc content onto my xbox?
response: No. Internet is not required to download the dlc. Its a seperate disc to download.

context: Can this be hooked up to my Xbox One and PS4 simultaneously?
response: No.  There is only one optical input.  You may use a switcher to select the input.

context: Does this work with Windows 8? We have a not-so powerful desktop running on Windows 8 and have concerns about it working. Any advice?
response: Sorry, I have Windows Vista, and it works great. It is a great game, hope you can play it.

context: Can I listen to in-game sound and my mp3 player simultaneously? Like, if I turn off the in game music and leave on in game sfx and then play my mp3?
response: Yes u can listen to both at the same time

context: does it play on a new 2ds?
response: Pokemon X and Y should play on the 2DS. My brother had Pokemon X on the 2DS.

context: Does this work on a Wii U to play the newest Smash Brothers? Can someone Confirm yes or no?
response: Scott, this is an adapter for the computer, not the Wii U, you can however buy these for the Wii U, they work perfectly: Mayflash Nintendo GameCube Controller Adapter for Wii/Wii U

response: Yes you can.....we have bought an extra license for several editions of QB....all can be connected into 3 pack.....

response: works with my Macbook Air, so I don't see why not...

context: Can you see the keys clearly with the back light off?
response: Yes I can. There is an on/off button for the backlight, no dim. The wristpad does make a difference as well, very comfortable.

context: Hi, Does this product includes the CD-Key needed to register and play?
response: Yes, you'll recieve a game key. You'll still need to download the game client, and set up an account, then you are good to go!

context: how wide is the keyboard?
response: It's 19 3/4" inches wide and can tell you that I have owned many keyboards and this is by far the best.

context: Can this system download movies from a PC?
response: It can but I do not recommend one for watching movies, the 3DS has a 10 minute limit video playback so the movie would be broken up to 10 min parts.

context: The new ps vita slim model fits well in this case????
response: You do not have to "jam it in" there. it fits with a gentle push. And it fits snugly, so theres no movement.

context: Is the dream world too cheesey? Or is it not?
response: First let me say that I'm a huge Mario fan!  This game is really silly though.  I stopped playing it after only one day.  For me there were too many tutorials and too much "talking".  Not worth the money in my opinion.  Get yourself another Mario game, unless you have them all :P
